questions.question_text: You must replicate to JMS Queues. Which product in the Oracle GoldenGate portfolio should be used?
Which statement is valid for DDL replication?

discussion.content:
Object names must be fully qualified with their two-part or three-part names when supplied as input to any parameters that support DDL synchronization. You can use the question mark (?) and asterisk (*) wildcards to specify object names in configuration parameters that support DDL synchronization, but the wildcard specification also must be fully qualified as a two-part or three-part name. To process wildcards correctly, the WILDCARDRESOLVE parameter is set to DYNAMIC by default. If WILDCARDRESOLVE is set to anything else, the Oracle GoldenGate process that is processing DDL operations will abend and write the error to the process report.
D is the answer
https://docs.oracle.com/en/middleware/goldengate/core/21.3/oracle-db/configuring-ddl-support.html#GUID-B73C7C8F-D270-4679-8C62-10A557B0418C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.C: Target objects can be different from source when using SOURCEDEFS in Replicat.
choices.B: Source and target objects can be different.
choices.A: GoldenGate User Exits are not supported for DDL.

questions.question_text: You installed GoldenGate on your server, but you received an error when you tried to start GGSCI. What is the reason for this issue?

discussion.content: my opiniion,, it is not possible to install a wrong version. i will choose D.
D looks to be the answer

If the incorrect version was installed so It's not even installed or considered as installed. so the correc tricky answer is D. That $ORACLE_HOME/lib so popular issue raises in this old version of OGG.

choices.D: The LD_LIBRARY_PATH variable to $ORACLE_HOME was not set.
choices.A: The incorrect version of GoldenGate was installed for your CPU architecture.
choices.C: GoldenGate Manager was not started first.
choices.B: A license key must be applied first.

questions.question_text: Identify the correct statement regarding Trails.

discussion.content: rmttrail is for pump, the trail files can be local and can be remote.
Identify the correct statement regarding >>>Trails<<<.: C is the correct one.
The answer for this should be C, I think.

choices.B: Extracts cannot perform filtering, mapping, and transformations.
choices.A: Extract and Pump are different OS level executable binary files.
choices.C: RMTTRAIL is for remote trails and EXTTRAIL is for local trails.
choices.D: Extract is typically used to produce local trail files over a TCP/IP connection.

questions.question_text: Replicat makes checkpoints in the trail file to mark its last read position. Select two ways to create checkpoint tables.

discussion.content: B and E are the correct answers
B and E are the correct answers

choices.C: Use the ADD Extract Trail command.
choices.D: Use the INFO REPLICAT command with the SHOWCH option.
